ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Please drop the text book - its insulting to our intelligence. It was written for a remedial eighth grade class.
N/A

Prof. Morico is great, but this course is not helpful for older students with work experience. I was hoping for a more comprehensive overview of leadership and management, not just to hear about Prof. Morico's experiences throughout her career.I understand that the MEM is not a professionalized degree, however, FES needs to offer more in the way of developing leadership and management training skills.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The class discussions!
The free dinners and Kim's stories.
Kris is extremely knowledgeable about environmental management, and is a warm and engaging teacher.
it was just 5 weeks.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: eh, I felt like it was story time sometimes, but that was fine by me.
It might be helpful to follow the syllabus more closely, or provide hand-outs or something. Sometimes it was hard to determine a take-away from each class.
The class wasn't really helpful. It was missing actual educational value.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: N/A

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: It was a brief course and seemed interesting.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I'm interested in leadership and better management.
I was interested in learning how business approaches environmental problems, and learning some professional skills.
To gain some real professional insights.
To gain leadership and management skills for a mid-level professional.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: sure
Yes, I did learn quite a bit.
No.
No.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: We did our project in 45 minutes and did fine. So no real comments.
It was nice to put together a presentation together, because each of us could focus on a different aspect of the company, and then bring it together to get a broader understanding.
I liked the people I worked with; didn't really get a lot out of it.
it was a great learning experience.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Enjoy the food and bring tupperware.
Enjoy, and take advantage of the resources.
Don't - it's actually a waste of time.
